edu.rit.m2mi.matrix2
Interface Coordinator

All Known Implementing Classes:
CoordinatorImpl
public interface Coordinator

Interface Coordinator specifies the interface for an exported M2MI object that coordinates the computation of the product of two matrices. The source matrices send their rows and columns, respectively, to the coordinator. The coordinator in turn sends each row or column just to the workers that need it.

M2MI Library Version 02-Jul-2002

Method Summary
 void compute(Matrix theMatrix)
          Specify the product matrix to be computed.

          Obtain a row from the first matrix in the product.
 

Method Detail

compute

public void compute(Matrix theMatrix)
Specify the product matrix to be computed. The workers will store their results by invoking setElement() on the given Matrix handle.

Parameters:
theMatrix - Matrix handle in which to store results.

putRow

public void putRow(int row,
                   float[] vals)
Obtain a row from the first matrix in the product. The values are passed on to just those workers that are computing elements in the given row.

Parameters:
row - Row index.
vals - Values in the row.

putColumn

public void putColumn(int col,
                      float[] vals)
Obtain a column from the first matrix in the product. The values are passed on to just those workers that are computing elements in the given column.

Parameters:
col - Column index.
vals - Values in the column.
